Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that Senate leaders have encouraged lawmakers to wear masks this year to combat the spread of COVID-19.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it relies on a misleading photo that was not taken during the pandemic.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that Democratic senators were not wearing masks based on a photo that is unrelated to the current pandemic situation.
Exist alternative explanation: An alternative explanation is that the senators in the photo were not wearing masks because it was taken in 2018, before the COVID-19 pandemic.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the absence of masks by implying that Democratic senators were intentionally not wearing masks, when in fact the photo was taken before the pandemic.
Understate: There is no evidence of understating bias in this claim.
Falters at times: The claim falters by using a misleading photo to suggest that Democratic senators were not wearing masks during the Judiciary Committee hearing for Amy Coney Barrett.
